h5_mod

This module contains functions that load/save FEniCS mesh and functions into the hdf5 format

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_get_group(h5_file)
flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_get_time_stamp(h5_file, h5_group)

Get a list of time stamps from a specified HDF5 file and group.

Parameters:

h5_file (str): Path to the HDF5 file containing the data. h5_group (str): Name of the HDF5 group within the file where the timestamps are stored.

Returns:

numpy.ndarray: An array containing the time stamps extracted from the HDF5 dataset.

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_init_output_file(output_file, mesh=None, boundaries=None, subdomain=None)

Initializes an HDF5 output file with the mesh, boundaries, and subdomain data. Use this function to initialize the output file for the simulation.

Parameters:

  • output_file (str) – Path to the .h5 file to initialize

  • mesh (fe.Mesh) – FEniCS mesh object to write into the initial output file (Optional)

  • boundaries (fe.MeshFunction) – The fenics MeshFunction object with marked boundary (Optional)

  • subdomain (fe.MeshFunction) – The fenics MeshFunction object with marked subdomain (Optional)

Returns:

The initialized FEniCS hdf5 file object

Return type:

fe.HDF5File

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_read(h5_file, h5_group, fe_type, mesh=None, meshFunctionDim=None, function_space=None, time_id=None)

Reads FEniCS Mesh, MeshFunction, or Function object from a HDF5 file

Parameters:

  • h5_file (str) – Path to the HDF5 file.

  • h5_group (str) – Name of the hdf5 file group

  • fe_type (str) – Type of data you want to save - must be ‘mesh’, ‘meshfunction’, or ‘function’.

  • mesh (fe.Mesh) – FEniCS mesh the function or function space are defined on (required for fe_type=’meshfunction’).

  • meshFunctionDim (int, optional) – The dimension of the function_space (required for fe_type=’meshfunction’).

  • function_space (fe.FunctionSpace optional) – Function space the Function type is defined on (required for fe_type=’function’).

  • time_id (int, optional) – Specify the index of the function in the time series you want to read.

Returns:

The data stored in the file h5_file with HDF5 group=`h5_group` of type fe_type.

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_read_mesh(h5_file, mesh_name='mesh', boundaries_name='boundaries', subdomain_name='subdomains', comm=<mpi4py.MPI.Intracomm object>)

Read mesh, boundaries, and subdomains in accordance with h5init_output_file method Input: h5_read_mesh(h5_file, mesh_name=”mesh”, boundaries_name=”boundaries”, subdomain_name=”subdomains”) Return (mesh, boundaries, subdomains), if boundaries or subdomains do not exist, they are returned as None mesh must exist

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_to_pvd(h5_file, h5_group, pvd_file, func_type, elem_type, elem_order, save_interval=None, mesh_h5_group='/mesh', varname='default')

Convert function data from a HDF5 file into a paraview readable file format. The HDF5 file must have the mesh group saved on it. This is usually a a HDF5 file that’s created by the h5_init_output_file function

Parameters:

  • h5_file (str) – Path to the .h5 file.

  • h5_group (str) – Name of the h5 variable you want to convert.

  • pvd_file (str) – Path to the ParaView pvd file.

  • func_type (str) – Either ‘scalar’ or ‘vector’. This determines the type of function space used.

  • elem_order (int) – Order of the element used to save the initial dataset. This must match the order used in the simulation!!!

  • save_interval (list[int, int]) – (Optional) A Python list of 2 entries [i1, i2] where the data will be converted from time index i1 to time index i2.

flatiron_tk.io.h5_mod.h5_write(instance, h5_group, h5_file=None, h5_object=None, timestamp=None, mode='a')

Writes FEniCS Mesh, MeshFunction, or Function object into a hdf5 file format

Parameters:

  • instance (fe.Mesh or fe.MeshFunction or fe.Function) – The FEniCS data you want to save.

  • h5_group (str) – HDF5 group within the HDF5 file structure to write the instance to.

  • h5_file (str, optional) – HDF5 file name to write to. If h5_file is specified, h5_object cannot be specified

  • h5_object (fe.HDF5File, optional) – FEniCS HDF5File object one wants to save the data to. If h5_object is specified, h5_file cannot be specified

  • timestamp (float, optional) – Timestamp for the function. Used for writing time series.

  • mode (str) – “a” for append, or “w” for overwrite
